text: Iran competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Swimming== Iran entered two swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Benyamin Gharehassanloo |align=left|50 m freestyle |23.39 |61 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m freestyle |51.49 |66 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=2|Alireza Yavari |align=left|200 m freestyle |1:56.28 |58 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m butterfly |55.63 |51 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ==References== Category:Nations at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships Category:Iran at the World Aquatics Championships Category:2019 in Iranian sport
title: Iran at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships
